name: Mozilla Firefox
desc: Firefox is a Web browser that is smaller, faster, and in some ways more secure than the Mozilla browser from which much of its code was originally derived.

name: Comon Voice
desc: Common Voice is Mozilla's initiative to help teach machines how real people speak. But to create voice systems, developers need an extremely large amount of voice data.

name: FileZilla
desc: FileZilla Client is a fast and reliable cross-platform FTP, FTPS and SFTP client with lots of useful features and an intuitive graphical user interface.

name: Rust
desc: A language empowering everyone to build reliable and efficient software.

name: KeePass
desc: KeePass is a free open source password manager, which helps you to manage your passwords in a secure way. You can put all your passwords in one database, which is locked with one master key or a key file.

name: Mozilla Thunderbird
desc: Thunderbird is a free and open source email, newsfeed, chat, and calendaring client, that’s easy to set up and customize.

name: PDF.js
desc: PDF.js is community-driven and supported by Mozilla Labs. Our goal is to create a general-purpose, web standards-based platform for parsing and rendering PDFs.

name: Firefox Monitor
desc: Firefox Monitor warns you if your online accounts were involved in a known data breach. See if your information was exposed in a data breach.

name: Spoke
desc: Explore images, videos, and 3D models from around the web, all without opening up a new tab. With media integrations from Sketchfab and Google Poly, you'll be on your way to creating a scene in no time.

name: apps-design
desc: Design Guidelines for Open Web Apps.
